newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila grains buyers await further price dips.
newsitem.headline: Manila grains buyers await further price dips.

text.p: Philippine grains buyers encouraged by softer wheat prices are expected to revert back to the market next week but are still chancing on further price tumbles.
"Some traders still feel that prices can still go lower and you'll see them pounce in the market once prices do," said one trader.

The fall of U.S. wheat, corn, soyoil, soybean and soymeal prices this week due to a USDA report of better-than-expected carryover stocks inspired flour mills in Manila who said they would soon venture into the market.
Last week, Philippine flour mills sent tender invitations for 90,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat but only one mill bought 7,500 tonnes of soft wheat due to higher offers.
Late on Thursday, a Philippine mill bought 16,000 tonnes of Canadian dark northern spring wheat, 7,000 tonnes of U.S. western white wheat and 7,000 tonnes of soybean for August delivery.
A senior trader said one mill was also negotiating for a 25,000 tonne of U.S. wheat for June delivery but is waiting for prices to weaken further.
"We are waiting for price breaks," the trader said.
Imports for corn and rice are not expected next week as supplies are sufficient, government officials said.
The state-run National Food Authority said the country's rice stocks as of end-April reached 1.60 million tonnes compared with 1.44 million a year ago.
The prevailing flour and corn prices in Manila in pesos:
Retail price of yellow corn per kg 9.67 9.72
Retail price of white corn per kg 9.90 10.15
